entries.content: Objections are not rejections but requests for more information to help the prospect make a decision.
entries.notes: Implied in the broader context of handling objections as part of the sales process.

entries.content: Your job is to get the prospect to convince you they need your help, not to convince them to buy.
entries.notes: Shifts the dynamic from persuasion to mutual agreement on the problem and solution.

entries.content: Ask tough, challenging questions to make the prospect realize the impact of their problem.
entries.notes: Encourages self-realization of need rather than direct persuasion.

entries.content: Have no emotional attachment to the outcome to avoid misery and maintain professionalism.
entries.notes: Reduces pressure on both the salesperson and the prospect, fostering a healthier sales environment.

focus_area: Objection Mindset: Objections = info requests, not rejections
